<strong style="display: block;">Why might managers be reluctant to issue new equity according to signaling theory?</strong>

<label><input type="radio" name="module9_mcq_q21" value="A"> A. Because issuing equity always increases firm value.</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module9_mcq_q21" value="B"> B. Because investors may interpret it as a signal that the firm’s stock is overvalued.</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module9_mcq_q21" value="C"> C. Because equity issuance reduces control for creditors.</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module9_mcq_q21" value="D"> D. Because it decreases the firm’s cash reserves.</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module9_mcq_q21" value="E"> E. Because taxes on dividends increase after equity issuance.</label><br>
</form>
